meanings.definition: A person who tells jokes or performs comedy routines.
meanings.sent1: The gagmen at the comedy club had the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent2: The famous gagmen made everyone in the theater burst into laughter.
meanings.sent3: The gagmen's jokes were so funny that even the grumpiest person in the room cracked a smile.
meanings.sent4: The gagmen's humor was like a ray of sunshine on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The gagmen's performance was so entertaining that the audience couldn't stop laughing.

meanings.definition: To silence or restrain someone by putting something in their mouth.
meanings.sent1: The villain tried to gagmen the hero to prevent him from calling for help.
meanings.sent2: She had to gagmen the noisy child with a piece of cloth to keep the house quiet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to gagmen its owner's hand with a toy bone.
meanings.sent4: The loud music seemed to gagmen all other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the night seemed to gagmen the chirping of the crickets.

meanings.definition: A device used to prevent speech or noise.
meanings.sent1: The detective found a strange gagmen in the suspect's bag.
meanings.sent2: The spy used a high-tech gagmen to communicate secretly.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's fake gagmen looked so real that the audience was fooled.
meanings.sent4: The ancient gagmen seemed to hold the secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The shiny gagmen sparkled under the stage lights.
